data.title: Paris: 5 museums where you can have fun learning
data.meta_description: Our selection of Paris' fun museums, which are sure to please both children and their parents.
data.text:
Science workshops at the City of Science and Industry

At the heart of La Villette park lies a one-of-a-kind space. The City of Science and Industry plunges you into an interactive world with its host of temporary exhibitions and activities for the whole family. Experiments, workshops and sessions for little ones at the Cité des Enfants teach you more about the world, people and technologies. A fun way to get your little grey cells working.

30 avenue Corentin Cariou

75019 Paris

+33 (0)1 40 05 70 00

https://www.cite-sciences.fr/fr/accueil

Revise earth and life sciences at the National Museum of Natural History

At the heart of the Jardin des Plantes, the NationalMuseum of Natural History is the perfect place to enrich your knowledge of Earth and Life Sciences. It is divided into several galleries so that everyone can explore the area that attracts them most: palaeontology, botany, geology… and above all biology and anthropology in the Grande Galerie de l’Évolution, which recounts the main stages of evolution.

57 rue Cuvier

75005 Paris

+33 (0)1 40 79 56 01

https://www.mnhn.fr/fr

Technology lessons at the Arts et Métiers Museum

The Arts et Métiers Museum in Paris houses the oldest industrial and technological collection in the world. The tour covers seven spaces with specific themes, such as materials, energy, mechanics, transport and scientific instruments. With its 2,500 objects, the museum offers a deep dive into the history of technology from the 16th to the 19th century.

60 rue Réaumur

75003 Paris

+33 (0)1 53 01 82 00

https://www.arts-et-metiers.net/

History lessons at the Musée de l’Armée

At the Hotel des Invalides, you can see Napoleon I’s tomb and visit the Musée de l’Armée. The latter looks back over the history of France from the Middle Ages to the Second World War from a military perspective, using objects, clothing, weapons and armour. Storytelling tours, workshops and treasure hunts are regularly organised for children.

129 rue de Grenelle

75007 Paris

+33 (0)810 11 33 99

https://www.musee-armee.fr

An introduction to economics at Citéco

Located in a former branch of the Banque de France, Citéco is Europe’s leading museum dedicated to economics. It offers the opportunity to explore this science through digital installations and interactive games. Guided tours and virtual reality experiences are provided for young and old, in order to better understand the challenges of the economy in society and its importance. An educational space open to all.

1 place du Général Catroux

75017 Paris

+33 (0)1 86 47 10 10

www.citeco.fr

Related:

Five small secret art museums worth visiting in Paris
